greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of f(x^3)^3 / f(x) in powers of x where f() is a Ramanujan theta function.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of q^(-1/3) * eta(q) * eta(q^4) * eta(q^6)^9 / (eta(q^2) * eta(q^3) * eta(q^12))^3 in powers of q.
a(n) = b(3*n+1) where b(n) is multiplicative with b(2^e) = - (1 + (-1)^e) / 2 if e>0, b(3^e) = 0^e, b(p^e) = e+1 if p == 1 (mod 6), b(p^e) = (1 + (-1)^3) / 2 if p == 5 (mod 6).
G.f. is a period 1 Fourier series which satisfies f(-1 / (36 t)) = (4/3)^(1/2) (t / i) g(t) where q = exp(2 Pi i t) and g() is the g.f. of A226535.
mathematica: a[ n_] := SeriesCoefficient[ QPochhammer[ -q^3]^3 / QPochhammer[ -q], {q, 0, n}]
program: (PARI) {a(n) = local(A); if( n<0, 0, A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( eta(x + A) * eta(x^4 + A) * eta(x^6 + A)^9 / (eta(x^2 + A) * eta(x^3 + A) * eta(x^12 + A))^3, n))}
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Sep 22 2013
